result.execSummary:
The defendant Roger A Mayer Jr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Operate Firearm While Intoxicated, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.20(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: To be paid within 30 days or penalty of 5 days Huber for non-payment.
Court orders the seizure and destruction of the firearm, but the destruction is not to occur until March 1, 2016.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Roger A Mayer Jr

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Roger A Mayer in court with attorney Anthony D Cotton.  Bryan C. Bayer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant pleads guilty to count #1.  Court finds the defendant guilty of count #1.  State makes recommendations.  Attorney Cotton makes statements.  Defendant makes statements.  
The Court Orders the Following to count #1:
FINE: $505.00
Court orders the seizure and destruction of the firearm, but the destruction is not to occur until 3/1/2016.  
 Total costs/fine/forfeiture: to be paid within 30 days .  Failure to pay; the Court orders the defendant to serve 5 days in Huber

Defendant Roger A Mayer in court with attorney Anthony D Cotton.  Brian J. Juech appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Cotton was just retained.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for January 20, 2016 at 09:00 am.
Filed with cover letter dated November 19, 2015 from Atty Anthony Cotton

Defendant Roger A Mayer in court.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant would like to take the DA's pretrial offer.  Defendant states he has taken AODA classes and Firearm Safety classes.  Court steps down so the parties can talk.  Court reconvenes at 8:50 am.  State accepts the documents shown regarding treatment and classes.  Defendant requests additional time.  Court adjourns this matter.  Hearing scheduled for December 14, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant is not to possess any knives/weapons/firearms.

Defendant Roger A Mayer in court.  Kristi J Gordon appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court advises of right to an attorney.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED BY COURT.
  Hearing scheduled for November 13, 2015 at 08:30 am.
